intro: Crotalaria mumbwae, commonly known as Mumbwa crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers with prominent yellow veins, and its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
